verses.roman:
vyāghra-mṛga anyonye kare āliṅgana
mukhe mukha diyā kare anyonye cumbana

synonyms: vyāghra-mṛga—the tigers and deer; anyonye—one another; kare—do; āliṅgana—embracing; mukhe mukha diyā—touching one anothers' mouths; kare—do; anyonye cumbana—kissing one another.
translation: Indeed, the tigers and deer began to embrace one another, and, touching mouths, they began to kiss.
